alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 8:03PM MDT until July 08 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTY... At 803 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms ending over Tecolote Creek within the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Up to 1.43 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing in Mineral Hill, and may begin shortly further down stream. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Tecolote Creek drainage area including Cabo Lucero Creek, Canon Mesteno, Ojitos Frios Creek and Tecolote Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Geronimo, San Pablo, Mineral Hill and Ojitos Frios. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 between Mile Markers 6 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. At 750 PM MDT the Mineral Hill Fire Department reported water beginning to exceed bank full in Mineral Hill near the intersection of Road A-19A and A-17. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flash flood deaths occur in automobiles.
